verses.kjv: In the seventh month, in the one and twentieth day of the month, came the word of the LORD by the prophet Haggai, saying,
verses.ct: On the 21st day of the 7th month, the LORD spoke through the prophet Haggai, saying,

verses.kjv: Speak now to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest, and to the residue of the people, saying,
verses.ct: "Tell this to Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua son of Josedech, the high priest, and to the rest of the people:

verses.kjv: Who is left among you that saw this house in her first glory? and how do ye see it now? is it not in your eyes in comparison of it as nothing?
verses.ct: Is anyone still alive among you who remembers this temple in its original glory? How does it look to you now? Doesn't it seem like nothing compared to what it was?

verses.kjv: Yet now be strong, O Zerubbabel, saith the LORD; and be strong, O Joshua, son of Josedech, the high priest; and be strong, all ye people of the land, saith the LORD, and work: for I am with you, saith the LORD of hosts:
verses.ct: But take courage, Zerubbabel, says the LORD. Take courage, Joshua son of Josedech, the high priest. Take courage, all you people of the land, says the LORD, and get to work — because I am with you, says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: According to the word that I covenanted with you when ye came out of Egypt, so my spirit remaineth among you: fear ye not.
verses.ct: This is the promise I made with you when you came out of Egypt, and my spirit remains among you. Don't be afraid.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts; Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens, and the earth, and the sea, and the dry land;
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says this: In just a little while, I will shake the heavens and the earth, the sea and the dry land.

verses.kjv: And I will shake all nations, and the desire of all nations shall come: and I will fill this house with glory, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: I will shake every nation, and the treasured things of all nations will pour in, and I will fill this temple with glory, says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: The silver is mine, and the gold is mine, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: All the silver belongs to me, and all the gold belongs to me, says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: The glory of this latter house shall be greater than of the former, saith the LORD of hosts: and in this place will I give peace, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: The glory of this new temple will surpass the glory of the first one, says the LORD of hosts. And in this place I will bring peace, says the LORD of hosts."

verses.kjv: In the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the LORD by Haggai the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: On the 24th day of the 9th month, during the 2nd year of Darius, the LORD spoke through the prophet Haggai, saying,

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,
verses.ct: "The LORD of hosts says this: Put this question to the priests about the law:

verses.kjv: If one bear holy flesh in the skirt of his garment, and with his skirt do touch bread, or pottage, or wine, or oil, or any meat, shall it be holy? And the priests answered and said, No.
verses.ct: If someone carries consecrated meat in the fold of their clothing, and that fold touches bread, stew, wine, oil, or any other food, does that food become holy?" The priests responded, "No."

verses.kjv: Then said Haggai, If one that is unclean by a dead body touch any of these, shall it be unclean? And the priests answered and said, It shall be unclean.
verses.ct: Then Haggai asked, "If someone who has become unclean by touching a dead body touches any of these things, does it become unclean?" The priests answered, "Yes, it becomes unclean."

verses.kjv: Then answered Haggai, and said, So is this people, and so is this nation before me, saith the LORD; and so is every work of their hands; and that which they offer there is unclean.
verses.ct: Haggai replied, "That is exactly how it is with this people and this nation in my presence, says the LORD. Everything they do and everything they offer here is unclean.

verses.kjv: And now, I pray you, consider from this day and upward, from before a stone was laid upon a stone in the temple of the LORD:
verses.ct: Now think carefully about what things were like before today — before one stone had been placed on another in the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: Since those days were, when one came to an heap of twenty measures, there were but ten: when one came to the pressfat for to draw out fifty vessels out of the press, there were but twenty.
verses.ct: During that time, when someone went to a grain pile expecting 20 measures, there were only 10. When someone went to the wine vat to draw out 50 measures, there were only 20.

verses.kjv: I smote you with blasting and with mildew and with hail in all the labours of your hands; yet ye turned not to me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I struck your crops with scorching wind, mildew, and hail — everything your hands worked for. Still, you did not return to me, says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Consider now from this day and upward, from the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, even from the day that the foundation of the LORD’s temple was laid, consider it.
verses.ct: Think carefully about what happens from this day forward — from the 24th day of the 9th month, the very day the foundation of the LORD's temple was laid. Pay close attention.

verses.kjv: Is the seed yet in the barn? yea, as yet the vine, and the fig tree, and the pomegranate, and the olive tree, hath not brought forth: from this day will I bless you.
verses.ct: Is there still grain left in the storehouse? The vine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree have not yet produced their fruit. But starting from this day, I will bless you."

verses.kjv: And again the word of the LORD came unto Haggai in the four and twentieth day of the month, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Haggai a second time on the 24th day of the month, saying,

verses.kjv: Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth;
verses.ct: "Tell Zerubbabel, governor of Judah: I am going to shake the heavens and the earth.

verses.kjv: And I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms, and I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the heathen; and I will overthrow the chariots, and those that ride in them; and the horses and their riders shall come down, every one by the sword of his brother.
verses.ct: I will topple the thrones of kingdoms and shatter the power of foreign nations. I will overturn chariots along with their drivers, and horses and their riders will fall — each one cut down by the sword of his own companion.

verses.kjv: In that day, saith the LORD of hosts, will I take thee, O Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel, saith the LORD, and will make thee as a signet: for I have chosen thee, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: On that day, says the LORD of hosts, I will take you, Zerubbabel my servant, son of Shealtiel, says the LORD, and I will make you like a signet ring, because I have chosen you, says the LORD of hosts."
